brief.content-text:
The switch, S1, is connected to four hosts labeled H1 to H4. The switch, S2, is connected to four hosts labeled H5 to H8. S1 is connected to S2.

H1 sends a packet to destination MAC address: FFFF.FFFF.FFFF. When S1 receives the packet, it looks for the destination MAC address. It is a broadcast, so the packet is forwarded to all ports except the port on which the packet originally traveled.

When S2 receives the packet that S1 has broadcast, it sees it is a broadcast, so the packet is forwarded to all ports except the port on which the packet originally traveled.
